intro: Spermacoce linifolia, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Spermacoce linifolia is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
